card.description: "a self-described 'limousine liberal' who bragged about the influence his money bought him"
card.title: LA Times: Major Democratic donor may have stolen donation money from his injured clients

_source.content: https://hotair.com/john-s-2/2022/09/22/la-times-major-democratic-donor-may-have-stolen-donation-money-from-his-injured-clients-n498349Last year, a big Democratic donor named Ed Buck was convicted of nine felonies connected to the overdose deaths of two black men at his apartment. Buck had given a total of about $500,000 to a host of Democratic politicians including Ted Lieu, Adam Schiff, Karen Bass, Xavier Becerra, Gavin Newsom and Eric Garcetti.Ed Buck was a small time Democratic donor when compared to LA lawyer Tom Girardi. Over decades of donations, Girardi and his wives donate around $4 million to various Democrats. About half of that money was donated at a time when Girardi’s fortunes were declining.The Los Angeles legal legend was a major party donor for decades, a self-described “limousine liberal” who bragged about the influence his money bought him in the selection of judges. He poured millions into local, state and national races personally and lined up additional donations from his wife, “Real Housewives of Beverly Hills” star Erika; the employees of his law firm; and the multitude of California trial lawyers who did business with him — or hoped to.Girardi kept throwing splashy fundraisers and writing big checks even as his financial situation grew dire. In the last decade, he defaulted on a series of high-interest loans and was forced to liquidate his stock portfolio yet he and his wife still doled out more than $2 million to the national Democratic Party and individual candidates, election filings show.Those receiving funds included presidential contenders Joe Biden ($11,200), Barack Obama ($62,500) and Hillary Clinton ($60,400), Gov. Gavin Newsom ($66,900), U.S. Sen. Dianne Feinstein ($18,700), former state Insurance Commissioner Dave Jones ($37,244), L.A. Mayor Eric Garcetti ($9,500) and City Atty. Mike Feuer ($11,000).Those are just a few of the elected Democrats who’ve received money from Girardi. Other names mentioned in the story include Senators Mark Kelly, Tim Kaine, Claire McCaskill and Representatives Eric Swalwell and Katie Porter.The obvious question becomes: Where did Girardi come up with the money? The Times suggests it’s likely it was stolen from settlement money that should have gone to his own clients.Sen. Amy Klobuchar said she had separated a $5,400 donation she received from Girardi and it would eventually go to victims of his fraud. Rep. Adam Schiff said he would give a $2,000 donation he received to legal aid, though he only offered to do that after being contacted by the LA Times. Everyone else is just keeping the money.

_source.content: Nog een instituut die allang in de vullesbak had moeten verdwijnen..💢 Russia accused of war crimes in UkraineAfter suspending Moscow, the UN Human Rights Council sent a committee to Kiev to investigate alleged atrocitiesUkraine called for a special tribunal to judge the Russian military and civilian leadership on Friday, after a report by a UN group accused Moscow of war crimes. The “Independent International Commission of Inquiry on Ukraine” was dispatched by the UN Human Rights Council after it suspended Russia’s membership, and while it worked closely with the government in Kiev, it had no contact with Moscow.The three-member commission was led by Eric Mose, a Norwegian jurist who previously served on the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) and presided over the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda.Mose told the Council that the commission visited “27 towns and settlements,” inspected “sites of destruction, graves, places of detention and torture,” and “interviewed more than 150 victims and witnesses.” After meetings with the Ukrainian government, “international organizations, civil society and other relevant stakeholders,” it concluded that “war crimes have been committed by the Russian Federation in Ukraine,” according to the minutes of the Council meeting.
_source.contentraw:
Nog een instituut die allang in de vullesbak had moeten verdwijnen..

💢 Russia accused of war crimes in Ukraine

After suspending Moscow, the UN Human Rights Council sent a committee to Kiev to investigate alleged atrocities

Ukraine called for a special tribunal to judge the Russian military and civilian leadership on Friday, after a report by a UN group accused Moscow of war crimes. The “Independent International Commission of Inquiry on Ukraine” was dispatched by the UN Human Rights Council after it suspended Russia’s membership, and while it worked closely with the government in Kiev, it had no contact with Moscow.

The three-member commission was led by Eric Mose, a Norwegian jurist who previously served on the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) and presided over the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda.

Mose told the Council that the commission visited “27 towns and settlements,” inspected “sites of destruction, graves, places of detention and torture,” and “interviewed more than 150 victims and witnesses.”

After meetings with the Ukrainian government, “international organizations, civil society and other relevant stakeholders,” it concluded that “war crimes have been committed by the Russian Federation in Ukraine,” according to the minutes of the Council meeting.

card.title: Let her apologize or resign Salvini rages against The Euro Bloc’s blatant threats and interference in the Italian Elections

_source.content: Let her apologize or resign Salvini rages against The Euro Bloc’s blatant threats and interference in the Italian ElectionsIn response to a question about the upcoming elections in Italy, Ursula Albrecht (she married her title) the unelected and unelectable president of the EU bloc hinted that the European Commission will take action if things in Italy go in the same direction as in Hungary and Poland.The drug dealing oligarch’s threatening blackmail outraged millions of Italians and left most Europeans aghast at such blatant blackmail immediately before Italy’s general election to be held on September 25.The leader of the popular Italian League of the North party, Matteo Salvini, demanded an ‘apology or resignation’ of Leyen, who mentioned the ’instruments’ at Brussels’ disposal to punish possible violations of the democratic principles of the EU in the event of the victory of the ultra-conservatives in the parliamentary elections in Italy, Le Figaro reports.This is pretty rich coming from an unelected governing apparatus headed by two – not one but two unelected presidents and 27 decision-making commissioners whose positions were appointed by cohorts.It is sobering but unavoidable thought that the European Union’s governing ‘parliament’ is much less accountable are far less representative to the EU bloc’s citizens than were their Soviet counterparts before the collapse of the Soviet Bloc in 1990.In response to a question about the imminent elections in Italy, the favourite of which, according to polls, is a coalition of right-wing and far-right candidates, von der Leyen said: ‘If things go in a difficult direction (that is, towards Hungary and Poland), then we have the tools.’ At the same time, the head of the European Commission stressed: ’Regardless of which government is elected democratically, we will work together.’Von der Leyen’s words angered the conservative politician Matteo Salvini, whose party is part of a coalition declared as the favourite in the upcoming elections. Incidentally, the von der leyen was acquired on her marriage to a titled oligarch: her maiden name is Albrecht.‘What is this, a threat? Shameful arrogance. Respect the free, democratic and sovereign choice of the Italian people! Who pleases everyone, is useful to no one,’ he wrote on his social media account. ‘Either she apologizes or she resigns,’ Salvini added in an interview with Italian media. Similarly, Antonio Tajani, vice-president of Silvio Berlusconi’s Forza Italia party, reacted similarly to the words of the head of the European Commission, calling them interference in the election campaign.Meanwhile, Ursula Albrecht’s press secretary, Eric Mamer, recalled that the commission works ’with any government that emerges as a result of elections and is ready to work with the European Commission.’ ’It is clear that the President did not interfere in the Italian elections.’Then, with breath-taking hypocrisy adds: ‘When she mentioned the tools, she was referring to specific procedures carried out in other countries of the European Union.’https://europerenaissance.com/2022/09/24/let-her-apologize-or-resign-salvini-rages-against-the-euro-blocs-blatant-threats-and-interference-in-the-italian-elections/
_source.contentraw:
Let her apologize or resign Salvini rages against The Euro Bloc’s blatant threats and interference in the Italian Elections

In response to a question about the upcoming elections in Italy, Ursula Albrecht (she married her title) the unelected and unelectable president of the EU bloc hinted that the European Commission will take action if things in Italy go in the same direction as in Hungary and Poland.

The drug dealing oligarch’s threatening blackmail outraged millions of Italians and left most Europeans aghast at such blatant blackmail immediately before Italy’s general election to be held on September 25.

The leader of the popular Italian League of the North party, Matteo Salvini, demanded an ‘apology or resignation’ of Leyen, who mentioned the ’instruments’ at Brussels’ disposal to punish possible violations of the democratic principles of the EU in the event of the victory of the ultra-conservatives in the parliamentary elections in Italy, Le Figaro reports.

This is pretty rich coming from an unelected governing apparatus headed by two – not one but two unelected presidents and 27 decision-making commissioners whose positions were appointed by cohorts.

It is sobering but unavoidable thought that the European Union’s governing ‘parliament’ is much less accountable are far less representative to the EU bloc’s citizens than were their Soviet counterparts before the collapse of the Soviet Bloc in 1990.

In response to a question about the imminent elections in Italy, the favourite of which, according to polls, is a coalition of right-wing and far-right candidates, von der Leyen said:

‘If things go in a difficult direction (that is, towards Hungary and Poland), then we have the tools.’ At the same time, the head of the European Commission stressed: ’Regardless of which government is elected democratically, we will work together.’

Von der Leyen’s words angered the conservative politician Matteo Salvini, whose party is part of a coalition declared as the favourite in the upcoming elections. Incidentally, the von der leyen was acquired on her marriage to a titled oligarch: her maiden name is Albrecht.

‘What is this, a threat? Shameful arrogance. Respect the free, democratic and sovereign choice of the Italian people! Who pleases everyone, is useful to no one,’ he wrote on his social media account.

‘Either she apologizes or she resigns,’ Salvini added in an interview with Italian media. Similarly, Antonio Tajani, vice-president of Silvio Berlusconi’s Forza Italia party, reacted similarly to the words of the head of the European Commission, calling them interference in the election campaign.

Meanwhile, Ursula Albrecht’s press secretary, Eric Mamer, recalled that the commission works ’with any government that emerges as a result of elections and is ready to work with the European Commission.’ ’It is clear that the President did not interfere in the Italian elections.’

Then, with breath-taking hypocrisy adds: ‘When she mentioned the tools, she was referring to specific procedures carried out in other countries of the European Union.’

card.description: ENQUÊTE - Entre leur souhait de protéger la «magie de Noël», la nécessaire sobriété et l'explosion des factures d'électricité, les villes sont prises entre le marteau et l'enclume. Et doivent prendre des décisions difficiles.
card.title: Crise énergétique : aurons-nous des illuminations à Noël ?

_source.content: Pas de Noël cette année, remerciez Zelensky et Von der Leyen !J'attendais patiemment depuis longtemps cette annonce, l'électricité est trop cher, donc les illuminations de Noël seront supprimées !Les maires Franc Macs seront heureux de faire des trucs inclusifs lgbtq-marrons pour remplacer les guirlandes illuminées et les Joyeux Noël lumineux, déjà grand remplacés par le très franc-maçon "bonnes fêtes de fin d'année".Bientôt des brigades républicaines de sobriété énergétiques vont contrôler si vous avez osé mettre une guirlande électrique sur votre sapin : amende de 135€Les maires sont la création républicaine la plus abjecte...https://www.lefigaro.fr/conjoncture/crise-energetique-aurons-nous-des-illuminations-a-noel-20220923<<Alors que les prix de l'électricité donnent des sueurs froides à tous les acteurs, nombre de communes se retrouvent dos au mur. Inflation oblige, elles font des choix difficiles, perdant ici quelques degrés de chauffage, là des heures d'éclairage public. Symboliquement, certaines doivent même sacrifier... les décorations des fêtes de fin d'année, qui font pourtant rêver petits et grands et participent de la magie de cette période.Car la facture des illuminations peut rapidement grimper, en particulier lorsque les équipements sont anciens. Si les données récentes manquent, en décembre 2011, l'Agence de l'environnement et de la maîtrise de l'énergie (Ademe) notait que «la puissance fournie pour les illuminations de Noël est estimée à 1300 MW, dont les 3/4 sont liés à la consommation des ménages». Soit la puissance d'un réacteur nucléaire. «Avec les LED, les consommations unitaires ont drastiquement baissé. Attention cependant à l’effet rebond : comme ça consomme très peu, on en met partout !», nuance aujourd'hui l'Ademe.Pour nombre de communes, les décorations de Noël peuvent représenter une dépense superflue, alors que les comptes sont déjà plombés. Elles «vont avoir, en moyenne, une facture énergétique entre 20% et 30% plus élevée» cette année, rappelle Harold Huwart, maire de Nogent-le-Rotrou (Eure-et-Loir) et vice-président de l'Association des petites villes de France (APVF). Un constat partagé : «Sur le budget électricité, nous serons à 30.000 euros de plus. Sur le gaz, nous avions projeté 341.000 euros, il nous manquera 210.000 euros» en plus, énumère le maire d'Orchies (Nord), Ludovic Rohart. À Rombas, en Moselle, «la facture s'alourdira de 500 à 600.000 euros pour la ville», selon le maire, qui s'alarme d'un «raz-de-marée énergétique et financier».Alors, face à l'explosion des factures et aux appels à la sobriété énergétique, des maires voient d'un mauvais œil le coût des décorations de Noël. Une année normale, le seul budget d'installation des illuminations représente 40.000 euros à Orchies, note son maire. Tout compris, le coût atteint «25.000 à 30.000 euros» à La Roche-Jaudy (Côtes-d'Armor). À Vair-sur-Loire (Loire-Atlantique), Eric Lucas chiffre les décorations à «20.000 euros», un chiffre qui peut atteindre «25.000 euros» à Nogent-le-Rotrou.Des décisions difficiles sont donc prises. À Orchies, une commission réfléchit à la «problématique des fêtes de fin d'année», étudiant plusieurs scénarios, dont un où l'opérateur fournirait des boîtiers pour contrôler la consommation d'électricité, et un autre «où les guirlandes électriques seraient bannies». Ce scénario emporte l'adhésion du maire. À Rombas, la mairie a déjà annoncé une «réduction de plus de 80% des illuminations de Noël», utilisant l'argent économisé pour investir dans le remplacement de l'éclairage public en LED. «Nous avons pris la décision de ne plus mettre d'illumination de Noël, explique de son côté le maire de La Roche-Jaudy, Jean-Louis Even. C'est bien joli d'illuminer les rues, mais quand tout le monde aura froid et qu'il y aura des coupures...». Même décision à Vair-sur-Loire. À Avoriaz, station de ski de Haute-Savoie, la décision n'est pas encore tranchée, indique une représentante de l'office du tourisme. La commune pourrait limiter fortement ses illuminations : «Le but est de garder le charme [...], tout en minimisant l'impact sur l'environnement», plaide-t-on.Dans les petites communes privées d'illumination, les mairies s'organisent pour célébrer la fin d'année autrement. «À La Roche-Jaudy, le père Noël ne sera pas une ordure !», sourit Jean-Louis Even. Sa commune redistribuera l'argent économisé en finançant des subventions pour les foyers souhaitant acheter un poêle à bois. Des fêtes «plus solidaires, sociales, protectrices de l'environnement. Un vrai Noël !», veut croire l'élu. D'autres villes vont mettre à contribution des bénévoles pour construire des décorations visibles de jour, mais non la nuit. D'autres encore réfléchissent à des guirlandes solaires. Nogent-le-Rotrou remisera ses vieilles lampes à décharge au placard, éteindra ses décorations LED au matin et privilégiera des animations.@DemocratieParticipative
_source.contentraw:

Les maires Franc Macs seront heureux de faire des trucs inclusifs lgbtq-marrons pour remplacer les guirlandes illuminées et les Joyeux Noël lumineux, déjà grand remplacés par le très franc-maçon "bonnes fêtes de fin d'année".

_source.content: Good morning❗ ☕🇺🇸✝️ 📜🌄Daily Bible verseHe has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.Ecclesiastes 3:11🌄 Morning prayerLord, help us pause today to appreciate the boundless beauty You have surrounded us with, and to be humbly thankful for it.*🙏 In Jesus' name we pray.  Amen.🌄  Outward beauty is only skin deep but inward beauty reaches all the way to the heart.Let's all make the day count.**Charlie Daniels📣 It's Saturday, September 24, 2022, and the Obama/Biden administration was/(is) the most corrupt in US history. #Obamagate.- Dan Bongino⏱💣 1 Year and 247 Days of a "hostage situation." -Juanita Broaddrick🇺🇸🖋️Biden Executive actions: 574 as of September 22, 2022, including 99 executive orders, 101 presidential memoranda, 313 proclamations, and 61 notices. (Ballotpedia)The Biden Recession is here. Unemployment rate ticked up to 3.7%. The labor force participation rate rose to 62.4% in August. Good morning❗ ☕🇺🇸

✝️ 📜🌄
Daily Bible verse
He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
Ecclesiastes 3:11

🌄 Morning prayer
Lord, help us pause today to appreciate the boundless beauty You have surrounded us with, and to be humbly thankful for it.*
🙏 In Jesus' name we pray. Amen.

🌄 Outward beauty is only skin deep but inward beauty reaches all the way to the heart.
Let's all make the day count.*

*Charlie Daniels

📣 It's Saturday, September 24, 2022, and the Obama/Biden administration was/(is) the most corrupt in US history. #Obamagate.
- Dan Bongino

⏱💣 1 Year and 247 Days of a "hostage situation." -Juanita Broaddrick

🇺🇸🖋️Biden Executive actions: 574 as of September 22, 2022, including 99 executive orders, 101 presidential memoranda, 313 proclamations, and 61 notices. (Ballotpedia)
The Biden Recession is here. Unemployment rate ticked up to 3.7%. The labor force participation rate rose to 62.4% in August. Still, 50% of employers anticipate job cuts in the next six months.
Feds have raised the interest rates 5 times this year. Mortgage interest rates are over 6%. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell vows to keep at it until the job (of beating inflation) is done. At the rate Joe and Congress spend our money, I don't see how they can keep up. The feds raised interest rates .75 percentage points for the 3rd straight time on Wednesday.
Gas is $3.69/gallon.⬆️ (AAA) Uh-oh, it's already going back up. Inflation is 8.3%.😡 DOW tumbled 1,276 points for its worst day in 2 years.

RCP averages: Joe's job approval rating spread is -9.8%.
His job approval avg: 43.2%. (Reuters says 39%, -18 spread.)

Build The Wall
DC mayor Bowser is upset that her city shelters are being "overrun" with illegal aliens. In response, she has issued a limited public health emergency. At least 3 buses of illegals were unloaded in front of Kamala's Naval Observatory residence. Don't let up now, Gov. Abbott ❗
Eric Adams has opened 14 luxury hotels in NYC free to the illegals. Nearly 5 MILLION illegals have skipped across Joe's border already. TX Gov Abbott has now added Chicago to the destination list for illegals. Mayor Lightfoot is immediately busing them out to the suburbs.
Ron DeSantis sent 2 planes of illegals to Martha's Vineyard and the dems went berserk. 125 National Guard were immediately deployed to escort the 50 illegals out of the snobby neighborhood that says they welcome ALL. Using this model, we would need 12,500,000 Ice Agents at the border to eliminate the invasion.
Next stop: Joe's place in Wilmington, DE❓ DeSantis makes light of any lawsuits or investigations targeting him. I say, sue the Big Guy in the OO❗

On Covid
Ahead of the election, the CDC relaxes its stance on Covid and allows people to make their own decisions since 95% of Americans 16 and older have some resistance toCovid-19 ❗ The 🐘 in the room: "Young, healthy people are dying in large numbers by collapsing". No, the NIH still does NOT advise using ivermectin to treat Covid-19 except in clinical trials. The NIH is years behind the data and efficacy, and thousands have died because of it.
➡️ The UK starts paying out big bucks for injuries and deaths caused by the experimental Covid jab.⬅️

Current events.
Joe has spent 1.5 trillion dollars for 99 executive orders ❗ As congress controls the purse strings, t h a t should be illegal, and challenged NOW.
Biden gave his dark, divisive, speech on the "soul of the nation" at Independence Hall, Philadelphia, almost calling MAGA terrorists.
The FBI seized Mike Lindell's phone at a Hardee's drive thru in Minnesota. They asked him about Dominion voting machines in Colorado. Unconstitutional ❗

SCOTUS had a remarkable early 2022❗ WHO is the SCOTUS leaker❓ WE have not forgotten this matter.
SCOTUS begins hearing cases for the 2022-23 term October 3.

China announced more drills after the second bunch of dem politicians flew to Taiwan. Billions more US dollars sent to Ukraine.

Liz Cheney lost ❗ 👋

⛴️ ⛓️
Food shortages and supply chain issues abound. Robots are supposed to help fix it, says Peter Goodman, NYT. Here's a solution- Fire Mayor Pete❗ A railroad strike has been averted for now.

POTUS 45
Trump won the Dallas CPAC with 69% of the vote. His endorsed candidates have pretty much swept the primaries nationwide.
Merrick Garland (DOJ) authorized the FBI RAID on Mar-A-Lago with the knowledge and approval of the Biden White House. The "more than heavily" redacted documents were released.🙄
Raymond Dearie has been appointed special master.
Trump campaigned for NC Senate candidate Ted Budd in Wilmington to another overflowing crowd ❗

Durham Report
Can there be justice in DC?

It's National Bluebird of Happiness Day ❗

Days of The Year
